item.title: Super Mario Bros. Wonder Switch 2 Edition Release Date Revealed for March
item.content:encoded:
Nintendo has revealed that the Switch 2 Edition version of Super Mario Bros. Wonder will be arriving in March, bringing with it a number of fun new activities for you and your friends to try out.

The Switch 2 version of Super Mario Bros. Wonder was originally revealed during a Nintendo Direct back in September, and now, Nintendo has announced that the game will join its new console's lineup on March 26th as both a physical and digital release.

In a new trailer, Nintendo also goes over what you can expect if you decide to check out Super Mario Bros. Wonder on Switch 2. While some of the new features revolve around multiplayer, if you're a solo Wonder-er, you'll still have some extra challenges to enjoy.

Bellabel Park, which gives the Switch 2 Edition of Super Mario Bros. Wonder the second half of its name (Meetup in Bellabel Park), will play host to a range of new multiplayer attractions and activities, both co-op and competitive.

If that's not your speed, then you can enjoy the new Toad Brigade Training Camp, where you'll find a range of new challenges to try out across Super Mario Bros. Wonder's many courses.

You'll also find new Koopaling bosses scattered throughout some of the game's stages, and to help you take them on, Rosalina has become a playable character in the Switch 2 version of the game (and I'm sure it's no coincidence she's appearing in the upcoming Super Mario Galaxy Movie as well).

Other new features include the mouse-controlled Co-Star Luma and the new Assist Mode, which lessens some of Super Mario Bros. Wonder's challenge and makes your journey just a little less stressful.

Super Mario Bros. Wonder is available right now for Nintendo Switch, and it comes to Switch 2 on March 26th. You can check out our very own Austin's review here to find out what he thought.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: Pokemon TCG Pocket Fantastical Parade Expansion Launches Next Week
item.content:encoded:
The Pokemon Company has revealed Fantastical Parade, the new expansion for smash hit mobile game Pokemon TCG Pocket, and it's bringing some beautiful-looking new cards next week.

Fantastical Parade is a full-scale expansion along the lines of December's Crimson Blaze rather than a booster pack like Secluded Springs, so you can look forward to lots of new cards to transform your Pokemon TCG Pocket experience, plus a whole new mechanic to wrestle with.

Let's start with the new cards. Following the introduction of Mega Evolved Pokemon in October's Mega Rising expansion, Fantastical Parade is adding a number of new Mega Evolutions to the mix, including new ex cards for Mega Gardevoir, Mega Mawile, and Mega Ogerpon.

You can also look forward to regular cards for adorable 'mons like Vanillite and Pumpkaboo, as well as new Trainer cards like the Retreat Cost-lowering Peculiar Plaza and the Energy-sapping Piers.

As for that new mechanic, Stadiums are "a new type of Trainer card that can turn the tide of battle", according to The Pokemon Company. The aforementioned Peculiar Plaza card is a Stadium addition, and it's "especially tricky to handle for players using Psychic-type Pokemon", apparently.

Fantastical Parade is also packing a suite of new covers themed around expansion mascot Gardevoir. Those covers won't become available the moment the expansion drops, though; they'll be released starting from January 31st.

You can check out a trailer that shows off some of Fantastical Parade's lovely new cards, as well as its overall art style and aesthetic direction, right here.

Pokemon TCG Pocket celebrated its first anniversary back in October, and the game is showing no signs of slowing down in popularity terms; it's amassed over 150 million downloads so far and seems to be serving as a nice little moneyspinner for DeNA and The Pokemon Company.

You can download Pokemon TCG Pocket for free right now on Android and iOS. Stay tuned for more.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: GreedFall 2: The Dying World Release Date Revealed for March
item.content:encoded:
Publisher Nacon and developer Spiders have announced that their action RPG sequel GreedFall 2: The Dying World will launch in full on PC and consoles in March.

As revealed in a brand new trailer, GreedFall 2: The Dying World will be hitting PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S on March 12th, having been in Early Access for the last year and a half or so.

Since launching in September 2024, GreedFall 2 has received a number of updates, bringing features like new companions, quests, and story elements, as well as a crafting system, a new skill tree, and more. Now, it looks like the game is almost ready for release, or at least that's what Spiders and Nacon reckon.

In practice, some Steam reviewers beg to differ. GreedFall 2 has amassed a Mixed rating across over 500 reviews since its Early Access launch, and even more recent opinions point to what players perceive as game-breaking bugs, unfinished systems, and iffy optimization.

Of course, there's a good chance that Spiders and Nacon can turn around GreedFall 2 and fix its issues in time for launch in March; there are, after all, two months between now and then, which should be enough time to at least iron out some of the more troubling-sounding problems.

However, given that Spiders was hit by layoffs in July last year, the studio is operating at a reduced capacity compared to when GreedFall 2 launched, so you might want to temper your expectations accordingly if you're going to pick the game up on PS5 or Xbox.

If you're unfamiliar with GreedFall 2: The Dying World, it is, as the name implies, the sequel to the 2019 RPG GreedFall, although it's actually a prequel.

GreedFall 2 once again revolves around notions of colonialism and exploitation; this time, you're playing as a Teer Fradee native, who must navigate political intrigue and deadly fauna across the open world of Gacane.

GreedFall 2: The Dying World is available now on PC via Steam Early Access, and it's coming to PS5 and Xbox Series X|S on March 12th. Stay tuned for more.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph
